description: We keep calling this command over and over to find out how over committed disk is. However, the output that we care about (total size of the image, not total size on disk) is very unlikely to change. We could instead have a cache and then invalidate cache entries if we resized an image.
title: Cache calls to 'qemu-img info'

comments.content: We keep calling this command over and over to find out how over committed disk is. We could instead have a cache and then invalidate cache entries if we resized an image.

comments.content:
There seems to be another issue with this that will still result in an unneeded qemu-img info call:

libvirt driver's get_instance_disk_info calls qemu-img info twice:

if disk_type == "qcow2":
                backing_file = libvirt_utils.get_disk_backing_file(path) <--- one call
                virt_size = disk.get_disk_size(path)                                     <---- second call 
                over_commit_size = int(virt_size) - dk_size

We can cache the size and also avoid the second call entirely by simply refactoring these two utility functions.
